  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    org.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.PrincipalBuilder
    As of Kafka 1.0.0, use KafkaPrincipalBuilder instead. This will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.StateStoreSupplier
    use StoreSupplier
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.Stores.InMemoryKeyValueFactory
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.Stores.PersistentKeyValueFactory
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.DefaultPrincipalBuilder
    As of Kafka 1.0.0. This will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStreamBuilder
    Use StreamsBuilder instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.TopologyBuilder
    use Topology instead
  • Deprecated Exceptions 
    Exceptions and Description
    org.apache.kafka.common.errors.GroupCoordinatorNotAvailableException
    As of Kafka 0.11, this has been replaced by CoordinatorNotAvailableException
    org.apache.kafka.common.errors.GroupLoadInProgressException
    As of Kafka 0.11, this has been replaced by CoordinatorLoadInProgressException
    org.apache.kafka.common.errors.NotCoordinatorForGroupException
    As of Kafka 0.11, this has been replaced by NotCoordinatorException
    org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.TopologyBuilderException
    use Topology instead of TopologyBuilder

    Field and Description
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SslConfigs.DEFAULT_PRINCIPAL_BUILDER_CLASS
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release. In recent versions, the config is optional and there is no default.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

    Use StreamsConfig.DEFAULT_KEY_SERDE_CLASS_CONFIG instead.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SaslConfigs.SASL_ENABLED_MECHANISMS
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SaslConfigs.SASL_ENABLED_MECHANISMS_DOC
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SaslConfigs.SASL_KERBEROS_PRINCIPAL_TO_LOCAL_RULES
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SaslConfigs.SASL_KERBEROS_PRINCIPAL_TO_LOCAL_RULES_DOC
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SslConfigs.SSL_CLIENT_AUTH_CONFIG
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SslConfigs.SSL_CLIENT_AUTH_DOC
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsConfig.TIMESTAMP_EXTRACTOR_CLASS_CONFIG
    Use StreamsConfig.DEFAULT_TIMESTAMP_EXTRACTOR_CLASS_CONFIG instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsConfig.VALUE_SERDE_CLASS_CONFIG
    Use StreamsConfig.DEFAULT_VALUE_SERDE_CLASS_CONFIG instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsConfig.ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT_CONFIG
    Kakfa Streams does not use Zookeeper anymore and this parameter will be ignored.

    Method and Description
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<T>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, T>, Merger<? super K, T>, SessionWindows, Serde<T>)
    use windowedBy(sessionWindows) followed by aggregate(initializer, aggregator, sessionMerger, Materialized.with(null, aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<T>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, T>, Merger<? super K, T>, SessionWindows, Serde<T>, StateStoreSupplier<SessionStore>)
    use windowedBy(sessionWindows) followed by aggregate(initializer, aggregator, sessionMerger, Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier).withValueSerde(aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<T>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, T>, Merger<? super K, T>, SessionWindows, Serde<T>, String)
    use windowedBy(sessionWindows) followed by aggregate(initializer, aggregator, sessionMerger, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName).withValueSerde(aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedTable.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Serde<VR>)
    use aggregate(initializer, adder, subtractor, Materialized.with(null, aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedTable.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Serde<VR>, String)
    use aggregate(initializer, adder, subtractor, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName).withValueSerde(aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedTable.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, StateStoreSupplier<KeyValueStore>)
    use aggregate(initializer, adder, subtractor, Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedTable.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, String)
    use aggregate(initializer, adder, subtractor, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Serde<VR>)
    use aggregate(initializer, aggregator, Materialized.with(null, aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Serde<VR>, String)
    use aggregate(initializer, aggregator, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName).withValueSerde(aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, StateStoreSupplier<KeyValueStore>)
    use aggregate(initializer, aggregator, Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Windows<W>, Serde<VR>)
    use windowedBy(windows) followed by TimeWindowedKStream.aggregate(Initializer, Aggregator, Materialized) aggregate(initializer, aggregator, Materialized.with(null, aggValueSerde))}
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Windows<W>, Serde<VR>, String)
    use windowedBy(windows) followed by aggregate(initializer, aggregator, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName).withValueSerde(aggValueSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.aggregate(Initializer<VR>, Aggregator<? super K, ? super V, VR>, Windows<W>, StateStoreSupplier<WindowStore>)
    use windowedBy(windows) followed by aggregate(initializer, aggregator, Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.RecordMetadata.checksum()
    As of Kafka 0.11.0. Because of the potential for message format conversion on the broker, the computed checksum may not match what was stored on the broker, or what will be returned to the consumer. It is therefore unsafe to depend on this checksum for end-to-end delivery guarantees. Additionally, message format v2 does not include a record-level checksum (for performance, the record checksum was replaced with a batch checksum). To maintain compatibility, a partial checksum computed from the record timestamp, serialized key size, and serialized value size is returned instead, but this should not be depended on for end-to-end reliability.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord.checksum()
    As of Kafka 0.11.0. Because of the potential for message format conversion on the broker, the checksum returned by the broker may not match what was computed by the producer. It is therefore unsafe to depend on this checksum for end-to-end delivery guarantees. Additionally, message format v2 does not include a record-level checksum (for performance, the record checksum was replaced with a batch checksum). To maintain compatibility, a partial checksum computed from the record timestamp, serialized key size, and serialized value size is returned instead, but this should not be depended on for end-to-end reliability.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(SessionWindows)
    use windowedBy(sessionWindows) followed by count()
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(SessionWindows, StateStoreSupplier<SessionStore>)
    use windowedBy(sessionWindows) followed by count(Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(SessionWindows, String)
    use windowedBy(sessionWindows) followed by count(Materialized.as(queryableStoreName))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedTable.count(StateStoreSupplier<KeyValueStore>)
    use count(Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(StateStoreSupplier<KeyValueStore>)
    use count(Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedTable.count(String)
    use count(Materialized.as(queryableStoreName))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(String)
    use count(Materialized.as(queryableStoreName))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(Windows<W>)
    use windowedBy(windows) followed by count()
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(Windows<W>, StateStoreSupplier<WindowStore>)
    use windowedBy(windows) followed by count(Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KGroupedStream.count(Windows<W>, String)
    use windowedBy(windows) followed by count(Materialized.as(queryableStoreName))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.Stores.create(String)
    use Stores.persistentKeyValueStore(String), Stores.persistentWindowStore(String, long, int, long, boolean) Stores.persistentSessionStore(String, long), Stores.lruMap(String, int), or Stores.inMemoryKeyValueStore(String)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.filter(Predicate<? super K, ? super V>, StateStoreSupplier<KeyValueStore>)
    use filter(predicate, Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.filter(Predicate<? super K, ? super V>, String)
    use filter(predicate, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.filterNot(Predicate<? super K, ? super V>, StateStoreSupplier<KeyValueStore>)
    use filterNot(predicate, Materialized.as(KeyValueByteStoreSupplier))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.filterNot(Predicate<? super K, ? super V>, String)
    use filterNot(predicate, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.foreach(ForeachAction<? super K, ? super V>)
    Use the Interactive Queries APIs (e.g., KafkaStreams.store(String, QueryableStoreType) followed by ReadOnlyKeyValueStore.all()) to iterate over the keys of a KTable. Alternatively convert to a KStream using KTable.toStream() and then use foreach(action) on the result.
    org.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.KafkaPrincipal.fromString(String)
    As of 1.0.0. This method will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.groupBy(KeyValueMapper<? super K, ? super V, KeyValue<KR, VR>>, Serde<KR>, Serde<VR>)
    use groupBy(selector, Serialized.with(keySerde, valueSerde)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.groupBy(KeyValueMapper<? super K, ? super V, KR>, Serde<KR>, Serde<V>)
    use groupBy(selector, Serialized.with(keySerde, valSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.groupByKey(Serde<K>, Serde<V>)
    use groupByKey(Serialized.with(keySerde, valSerde))

    use join(otherStream, joiner, windows, Joined.with(keySerde, thisValueSerde, otherValueSerde))

    use join(other, joiner, Materialized.as(queryableStoreName).withValueSerde(joinSerde)

    use join(table, joiner, Joined.with(keySerde, valSerde, null))

Alternatively convert to a KStream using KTable.toStream() and then use print(Printed.toSysOut().withKeyValueMapper(...) on the result.

    use KTable.toStream() followed by to(topic) and and StreamsBuilder#table(topic, Materialized.as(KeyValueBytesStoreSupplier)) to read back as a KTable

    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.to(Serde<K>, Serde<V>, StreamPartitioner<? super K, ? super V>, String)
    use to(topic, Produced.with(keySerde, valSerde, partitioner)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.to(Serde<K>, Serde<V>, StreamPartitioner<? super K, ? super V>, String)
    use KTable.toStream() followed by to(topic, Produced.with(keySerde, valSerde, partioner)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.to(Serde<K>, Serde<V>, String)
    use to(topic, Produced.with(keySerde, valSerde))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.to(Serde<K>, Serde<V>, String)
    use KTable.toStream() followed by to(topic, Produced.with(keySerde, valSerde)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.to(StreamPartitioner<? super K, ? super V>, String)
    use to(topic, Produced.withStreamPartitioner(partitioner))
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.to(StreamPartitioner<? super K, ? super V>, String)
    use KTable.toStream() followed by to(topic, Produced.withStreamPartitioner(partitioner)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.to(String)
    use KTable.toStream() followed by to(topic)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.toString()
    Use KafkaStreams.localThreadsMetadata() to retrieve runtime information.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.toString(String)
    Use KafkaStreams.localThreadsMetadata() to retrieve runtime information.
    org.apache.kafka.common.Metric.value()
    As of 1.0.0, use Metric.metricValue() instead. This will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsConfig.valueSerde()
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.writeAsText(String)
    use print(Printed.toFile(filePath)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.writeAsText(String)
    Use the Interactive Queries APIs (e.g., KafkaStreams.store(String, QueryableStoreType) followed by ReadOnlyKeyValueStore.all()) to iterate over the keys of a KTable. Alternatively convert to a KStream using KTable.toStream() and then use print(Printed.toFile(filePath) on the result.

    use print(Printed.toFile(filePath).withKeyValueMapper(mapper)

    use print(Printed.toFile(filePath).withKeyValueMapper(...)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.writeAsText(String, Serde<K>, Serde<V>)

    use print(Printed.toFile(filePath).withKeyValueMapper(mapper)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.writeAsText(String, String)
    use print(Printed.toFile(filePath).withLabel(label)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.writeAsText(String, String)
    Use the Interactive Queries APIs (e.g., KafkaStreams.store(String, QueryableStoreType) followed by ReadOnlyKeyValueStore.all()) to iterate over the keys of a KTable. Alternatively convert to a KStream using KTable.toStream() and then use print(Printed.toFile(filePath).withLabel(label) on the result.
